entries.title: 'We want education, not indoctrination:' Ron DeSantis lays out the TRUTH about the 'history' class he banned
entries.description:
Last week, lefties went wild over the Florida Department of Education's decision to ban an Advanced Placement African American studies course on the basis it "lacked educational value." Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre called the move "incomprehensible" but not unexpected since Florida bans teachers from telling preschoolers who they like to bang. MSNBC's Joy Reid went so far as to claim Governor Ron DeSantis might have enjoyed the fascist World War II era- Italy.

In a press conference earlier today, Governor Ron DeSantis defended the department's decision. He explained that Florida actually requires teaching black history, but this course attempted to add a layer of indoctrination.

\u201cEducation is about the pursuit of truth, not the imposition of ideology or the advancement of a political agenda.\u201d
— Ron DeSantis (@Ron DeSantis) 1674492391

The course included Critical Race Theory, which DeSantis said he expected. But it also included "queer theory."

DeSantis explained, "That's the wrong side of the line for Florida standards. We believe in teaching kids facts and how to think, but we don't believe they should have an agenda imposed on them. When you try to use black history to shoehorn in queer theory, you are clearly trying to use that for political purposes."

Now, I'm not entirely sure what "queer theory" entails, particularly in regard to Black history. But my guess is, it's the study of being gay. According to MasterClass, the term means, "a field of study that examines the nature of sexuality- and gender-based normativity and how society defines and polices the concepts of heterosexuality, homosexuality, and gender and sexual identities." It says its goal is to "deconstruct what is acceptable or 'normal.'” Given the characters seen at Pride every year, I'd say they're succeeding on that front.

The Black Queer Studies portion of the proposed course is described as, "explor[ing] the concept of queer color critique, grounded in Black feminism and intersectionality, as a Black studies lens that shifts sexuality studies towards racial analysis.”

Full disclosure: I have not one iota of an idea as to what any of that means. One thing I do know: homeschooling is getting more and more appealing every day.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Patriot GOES OFF, tells reporter where government can stick its new 'only two alcoholic drinks a week' guideline
entries.description:
Canada wants to tell Canadians how much they think Canadians should drink. You saw how the people reacted to something like a schmaccine mandate. But telling -- I'm sorry, "suggesting to" -- Canadians they cut back on the Molsons could very well lead to an insurrection. And this man would be their leader. This man, who couldn't be any more Canadian if he was wearing a denim jacket with denim pants, Bret Hart sunglasses, and standing outside the liquor air-drumming to Rush's "YYZ."

The guideline used to be 15 alcoholic drinks a week for men and 10 drinks a week for women. The Canadian government reduced it to two drinks a week to "minimize the risk associated with drinking." I'm assuming the two drinks a week guideline is the same for however many genders Canada recognizes this week.

Media outlet blogTO took to the streets. And the streets answered.

Canadian Man Interviewed About New Drinking Guidelines youtu.be

Two drinks a week? Well, That’s just not feasible. Not in this country … Two drinks in a week, what’s that going to do for you? That’s not even going to get you through a day.

This man believes a more reasonable guidance would be four beers, but I think he means "a day" and not "a week." Six beers for him. But four beers minimum for other Canadians.

Our friend also brings up a good point. If they want to tell you how much beer you drink at home, what else can the government lecture you on?

Can I have two liters of pop?

He means soda. Canadians call soda "pop." They do it in some regions of America too. But anyone who says pop is wrong. It's soda. Say it with me now. SO-DA.

Can I have two liters of Pop? What's more healthy four beers or two liters of Coca-Cola? Do the math.

In fairness, the Canadian government is only SUGGESTING you limit alcoholic drinks to two a week. There aren't any laws mandating it. Yet.

As the last two years have taught us, government "suggestions" become government "mandates" rather quickly. Especially when it comes to mandating what you can and can't do in your own home.

ESPECIALLY in Canada.

entries.title: WATCH: Twitch streamer whines about being 'sexualized' in the gym. Also, she has men pay her for photos on the side.
entries.description:
Last week, a video posted by Twitch partner Jessica Fernandez went viral on Twitter. As of right now, it has 43.1 million views on Twitter and 660k on TikTok.

In the video, Jessica is doing hip thrusts at the gym. It's captioned, "this is how not to approach girls at the gym." Jessica tapes herself and mutters into the microphone, "I hate this, I hate this" and "f***ing feral."

She is apparently referencing a dude standing behind her trying to get his workout in. She has a "stare counter" going for each time he merely glances in her direction. At one point, he offers to re-rack the weights for her. She declines, and he goes away.

That's it. That's all that happens. It's quite boring, really.

\u201cthis guy kept making me extremely uncomfortable at the gym\u2026 this is why I\u2019ll end up crying on stream bc I feel so grossed out at times with the amount of sexualization I experience. Hopefully this spreads awareness for girls who experience this type of treatment at the gym\ud83e\udd79.\u201d
— Jessica49 (@Jessica49) 1674168121

However, Jessica was so offended by this man's behavior that she felt the need to video herself, comment on it, and upload it for millions of people to see how she was "sexualized" while working out.

As a female who enjoys working out in a gym where males are inevitably also present, I have some thoughts. First, a disclaimer: sometimes, dudes can be creepy. It happens. But from what Jessica uploaded, this seems like a bit of an overreaction.

Second, if you want to avoid being ogled in the gym, you should perhaps consider putting on a shirt. I don't care if you don't. Do what you want. But don't go to a public venue in a bra and then be upset when men look at you. That's not "internalized misogyny," it's just common sense.

And third, if Jessica felt so sexualized by this interaction, why upload it for literally millions of people to watch? And open it up to the possibility of more men sexualizing her?

The funniest part about all of this is Jessica apparently has a FanHouse, which is an OnlyFans competitor. Oopsie!

\u201chttps://t.co/QmzOha0m7Z\u201d
— Women Posting Their L\u2019s Online (Cult Leader) (@Women Posting Their L\u2019s Online (Cult Leader)) 1674486990

Nothing like complaining to the internet about being sexualized by men while making a living being sexualized by men on the internet. Thanks, feminism!

entries.title: Watch: Google employee vlogs about the glorified adult daycare she calls 'work.' Oh, and she just got laid off.
entries.description:
Last week, Google announced it was laying off 12,000 of its employees, roughly 6% of its entire workforce. The laid-off employees were caught off-guard, some of them having been recently promoted or long-tenured. Google has told its employees to save questions for an upcoming town hall.

Thankfully, this Google employee vlogged the day she got laid off from Google, so we can get the inside scoop. Nicole from @NicolesDailyVlogs on TikTok explained how she woke up to find she had lost access to everything and sobbed over the phone with her boss. Then she went on LinkedIn, which "wasn't great for her mental health." Finally, she went to Disneyland to "eat her feelings."

@nicolesdailyvlog

The Google layoffs were not how I expected to start off 2023, but I know it’s only up from here 🥲 #techlayoffs #googlelayoffs #techgirl #corporatelife #techvlog #dayinmylife #techlayoffs2023

She said the layoffs were "not performance based" and showed a bunch of texts from others telling her what a great worker she is. That would really stink, getting laid off for no reason despite your hard work ethic.

But hang on a second...Just a few weeks ago, Nicole vlogged her entire day working at Google. With such a high performance, it must be jam-packed with lots of hard work...right?

Of course not. It's basically an adult daycare.

Our gal Nicole started her day off by grabbing some candy from reception. Then she walks around and looks at the artwork in the office, noting you "could" sit down to get some work done, If you wanted. Or you could just peruse the pretty pictures.

Next, she goes to get a coffee. Then, finally, two meetings, followed by more beverages and pizza for lunch, which she notes is of course provided free of charge. Y'know, due to all the work.

@nicolesdailyvlog

Episode 2 | A Day in My Life Working from the Google LA office #techvlog #minivlog #lifeintech #lifeatgoogle #dayinmylife #techtok

Finally, she wraps up her day by petting a dog and relaxing in a massage chair to decompress after her long day of work. I, for one, am shocked she was laid off. Sometimes, life just isn't fair.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Dem congresswoman's - ahem, 'daughter' - gets arrested for assaulting cop during another mostly peaceful protest
entries.description:
Antifa is back, baby, and so are the arrests of Democratic politicians' totally mentally stable and sane children. The child of Democrat House Minority Whip Katherine Clark was arrested during an Antifa riot in Boston. Twenty-three-year-old Jared Dowell was allegedly vandalizing a monument with the phrases "ACAB" and "NO COP CITY".

Oh, and Jared apparently goes as "Riley." I'm not sure what to make of this, since Riley is an androgynous name.

\u201cIt appears that the child of Democrat House Minority Whip Katherine M. Clark was arrested for assaulting police as part of an #antifa event in Boston last night.\n\nJared 'Riley' Dowell allegedly graffiti'd "stop cop city" and assaulted police while resisting arrest.\u201d
— AntifaWatch (@AntifaWatch) 1674410419

Rep. Clark also tweeted her "daughter" was arrested, so I guess this "he" is actually a "she". I sincerely apologize for my previous misgendering.

\u201cLast night, my daughter was arrested in Boston, Massachusetts. I love Riley, and this is a very difficult time in the cycle of joy and pain in parenting. \n\nThis will be evaluated by the legal system, and I am confident in that process.\u201d
— Katherine Clark (@Katherine Clark) 1674427498

In my defense, this appears to be a fairly recent transition. He -er, she- was apparently originally just a plain old male. Then, nonbinary. Or is it trans nonbinary? Anyway now she/zhe's a woman. And totally not being exploited by her/their mother for political purposes.

\u201cJared "Riley" Dowell, the "daughter" of the Democrat House Minority Whip @RepKClark, has transitioned several times. Jared was trans nonbinary, but is now apparently identifying as a woman. Jared was arrested yesterday for assault at a violent #Antifa direct action.\u201d
— Andy Ng\u00f4 \ud83c\udff3\ufe0f\u200d\ud83c\udf08 (@Andy Ng\u00f4 \ud83c\udff3\ufe0f\u200d\ud83c\udf08) 1674435878

While she/he/zhe was being arrested, a group of twenty protestors allegedly surrounded police and began screaming at them through megaphones. An officer was hit in the face and began bleeding from his nose and mouth. So, by CNN's standards, mostly peaceful!

Jared/Riley was charged with assault by means of a dangerous weapon, destruction or injury of personal property, and damage of property by graffiti/tagging.

We probably should have seen this coming, given that Rep. Clark previously said her middle child has nightmares about climate change.

\u201cThe son of the Rep. Katherine Clark was arrested last night for assaulting a police officer during an Antifa event in Boston. \ud83d\udc6e\u200d\u2642\ufe0f\nhttps://t.co/WwyrCRvrvM\nAlso Katherine Clark: "I remember my middle child waking up with nightmares over concern around climate change." \ud83e\udd23\u201d
— Joni Job (@Joni Job) 1674425350

That's how Greta Thunberg started, and look at where she is now. Don't be like Greta. We can barely handle one.

This whole scenario is reminiscent of 2020, when Bill de Blasio's daughter Chiara de Blasio was arrested for unlawful assembly.

\u201cNew York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's daughter was arrested during protests Saturday night, according to police sources.\n\nChiara de Blasio was arrested for unlawful assembly and was later released. https://t.co/BmaV4gINnB\u201d
— CNN International (@CNN International) 1591007286

De Blasio later said he was "proud of her" for blocking traffic to end racism, but was upset that personal information was released in her arrest report.

Since it seems riot season is once again upon us, we can likely expect more kids of Democratic politicians to be arrested and praised for their courageous street-blocking and assault of police officers. So brave.

entries.title: Watch: Sheriff uses TikTok, classic 'Austin Powers' bit to mock a perp who shot himself in the d*ck
entries.description:
TikTok is a social media app run by the communist Chinese. One where you trade off giving all your personal information to communist China in order to tell the world how you self-identify as a frog. Americans should not be using TikTok. If you choose to play with the app anyway, I can't think of a better reason than a police officer using it to mock a perp for shooting himself in the wiener.

It includes the two things we here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com Website love the most: criminals getting their comeuppance, and excessive use of euphemisms.

@leecountysheriffsoffice Lee County man’s bad day gets even worse. #sheriffcarminemarceno #fyp #deputiesoftiktok #flordiaman #lawandorder #austinpowers ♬ SexyBack (feat. Timbaland) - Justin Timberlake

The odd thing is this isn't the first "Florida thug shoots himself in the dingly dangly" story we've seen. But with that dinkus (shooting his dinkus) Sheriff Grady Judd is too old school for TikTok and only mocked him with a press conference. Also, because we said his name...

Ladies and gentlemen, the greatest sheriff in America, Polk County Sheriff Grady Judd! pic.twitter.com/74BLkQEI9K
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) August 30, 2022

Let's get back to the sheriff at hand, Lee County's Carmine Marceno. Sheriff Marceno tells a tale of "a violent convicted felon roaming the streets of North Fort Myers on a scooter, with a stolen firearm in his waistband." The felon tried to kickstart the shooter, kickstarted the gun instead, and BLAM-O! Right in the ding dong.

Though being a public official, Sheriff Marceno did not make reference to the felon's now deformed genitalia himself. That would be inappropriate. Instead, he shared a clip from the movie Austin Powers. It was when Dr. Evil's phallic-looking rocket was flying through the sky, and everyone looked up making excessive references to a penis.

Trust me, it's hilarious. It was the 90s. You needed to be there.

Let's recap. TikTok is bad. Using TikTok to mock criminals is good. Shooting yourself in the d*ck, as long you're not the one shooting yourself in the d*ck, is never not funny.

entries.title: College soccer player got benched after refusing to take a knee for social justice, now her coach owes her $100k
entries.description:
Kiersten Hening used to play soccer for Virginia Tech. Then one day she didn't take a knee for Black Lives Matter while everyone else did. She stopped getting playing time after this, and after a lawsuit is now at least $100,000 richerfor having her First Amendment rights violated.

Here's what happened. Shortly after the George Floyd thing while virtue was being signaled from sea to shining sea, there was a "unity statement" from the Atlantic Coast Conference read before a home game against the University of Florida. All of Hening's teammates kneeled. She did not. In the lawsuit, Henning alleges she had her playing time cut as a result and was berated by Coach Charles “Chugger” Adair.

"At the next opportunity—halftime of the Virginia game—Coach Adair berated Hening for her stance.

"He singled her out and verbally attacked her, pointing a finger directly in her face."

To be clear, Hening agrees with the fact that black lives matter. Her problem is with the BLM Political Organization that wants to instill marxism and destroy the nuclear family. That is what she refused to take a knee for.

The school settled after a federal judge ruled Coach Adair may have violated Henning's First Amendment rights. The terms of the settlement were not revealed by a court document. They were revealed after a Twitter exchange when Coach Adair claimed the settlement absolved him of wrongdoing, and Henning's attorney Adam Mortara said NOPE!

If by clarity you mean you are paying my client six figures in a settlement then you’re right that’s pretty clear. Honestly, Coach, read the Court’s opinion. You are paying. Defendants don’t pay in cases that have no standing.
If by clarity you mean you are paying my client six figures in a settlement then you’re right that’s pretty clear. Honestly, Coach, read the Court’s opinion. You are paying. Defendants don’t pay in cases that have no standing.
— Adam Mortara (@AdamMortara) January 4, 2023

Henning showed courage and is now being rewarded for doing so. The system works!

entries.title: 'It never happened': Tim Allen denies 32-year-old allegation about his dong made in Pamela Anderson's new tell-all book
entries.description:
UPDATE: It's a thirty-two-year-old allegation. Brodigan forgot how to math this morning.

Actor Tim Allen allegedly showed off his power tool (say it with me now...MORE POWER) to Pamela Anderson on the set of Home Improvement. It's an allegation made in the actress's new book, and one the actor denies.

Picture it. The 90s. Grunge and the golden era of Hip Hop ruled the airwaves. A young Andrew "Dice" Clay made us laugh. And pre-teen boys across America snuck into their older brother's Playboy collection to see Pamela Anderson in the buff. Though at the time, she was "that blonde." People started to learn her name in 1991 when she landed a role on Home Improvement playing Lisa the Tool Time Girl.

The allegation made by Anderson in Love, Pamela is that on the very first day of filming, Allen flashed her his dingly dangly and said, quote, "it was only fair because he had seen [Anderson] naked. Now we’re even."

On the first day of filming, I walked out of my dressing room, and Tim was in the hallway in his robe. He opened his robe and flashed me quickly — completely naked underneath.

She then made twenty-two more appearances after the alleged incident. Allen issued a statement denying the claim.

No, it never happened. I would never do such a thing.

It is a he said/she said situation that allegedly happened thirty-two years ago, being used as the lead blurb to promote a book coming out at the end of the month. People are free to decide amongst themselves who they believe. You can assume the media will blindly believe Anderson over Allen, who they already hate. You know, what with the way he has a different political opinion than them and routinely mocks what they believe. Allen's mere existence makes them cry.

Allen playing Santa Claus was enough to send the left into meltdowns. This story involves his alleged penis.

What I will say is that, if the story is truthy, the actor is lucky it did not happen while Anderson was married to Motley Crue drummer Tommy Lee. Lee at the time would sometimes act in a brash manner. And I don't think Allen or the live studio audience would appreciate where the jackhammer wound up.
